content.description: Start just right of 'Schist for Brains'. Start below steep wall between 2 trees. The rock is a bit brittle for the first few moves, so move delicately and in balance. A 5 foot no fall zone to the second bolt on rounded hand and feet holds(shouldn't deck with attentive belay). A tricky mantle, following by an easy run out to a big ledge. The upper section is a little less steep and maybe 5.8 with good moves to the anchors.
content.protection:
10 bolts and 2 bolt anchor.

 1 rap with 70m rope gets you to tree at bottom of gully. Which then is 25' of 3rd class to ground/trail. Or, rap twice.

content.description: Start on rock apron just above ground level. Follow line up slab about 50'    then turn 90 degrees left (there is a bolt protecting traverse) and go to the start of 'Schist for Brains' and 'Battle of The Bulge'.
content.protection:
7 bolts and belay using trees.

 Rap off Tree.

content.description: Begin on low angle chunkie rock. Move up left clipping 2 bolts.   Then move left again UNDER a roof all the way to the left side(PG). Watch for chossy rock at your feet.   On left side of roof climb crack to a tree and bolt on your right.   Follow bolts up and left to pine tree growing horizontally out of the cliff.   From pine, clip bolt and continue following bolts up steeper terrain with big moves to blind holds. Anchors are at the very top of cliff.
content.location: Climb Sliding board for about 50' and turn left at bolted traverse. Move up to soil ledge near two trees. Belayer may want to clip in to the small smooth barked tree.   The route goes up and left from the tree.

content.description: Same stsart as Battle of the Bulge. Climb slab 15' right of to battle of bulge anchors
content.protection: TR off 'Battle of the Bulge' anchors. Parallel 'Battle of the Bulge' about 15 feet right of that line. When climbing gets a little steeper climb over right side of the over lap up high just before the anchors.

content.description: Start at belay on Schist for Brains.   climb RIGHT on slab up and over the bulge.   A fun cruiser
content.protection: 6 bolts and 2 bolt anchor. Rap back down route.

content.description: Steep slab 50' above the trail and right of Choss Wall.   Currently being sussed out.
